001package com.technototes.library.subsystem.drivebase;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorSimple;
004import com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.Range;
005import com.technototes.library.hardware.motor.Motor;
006
007/**
008 * Class for drivebase subsystems
009 *
010 * @param <T> The type of motor for the drivebase
011 * @author Alex Stedman
012 */
013public class TankDrivebaseSubsystem<T extends DcMotorSimple> extends DrivebaseSubsystem<T> {
014
015    /**
016     * Drive motors
017     */
018    protected Motor<T> leftSide() {
019        return motors[0];
020    }
021
022    protected Motor<T> rightSide() {
023        return motors[1];
024    }
025
026    /**
027     * Create tank drivebase
028     *
029     * @param leftMotor  The motor/motorgroup for the left side of the drivebase
030     * @param rightMotor The motor/motorgroup for the right side of the drivebase
031     */
032    public TankDrivebaseSubsystem(Motor<T> leftMotor, Motor<T> rightMotor) {
033        super(leftMotor, rightMotor);
034    }
035
036    public void arcadeDrive(double y, double x) {
037        double lp = y + x;
038        double rp = -y + x;
039        double scale = getScale(lp, rp);
040        double speed = Range.clip(Math.abs(y) + Math.abs(x), 0, 1);
041        scale = scale == 0 ? 0 : speed / scale;
042        drive(lp * scale, rp * scale);
043    }
044
045    public void stop() {
046        drive(0, 0);
047    }
048
049    public void drive(double l, double r) {
050        motors[0].setPower(l * getSpeed());
051        motors[1].setPower(r * getSpeed());
052    }
053}
